title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio homered in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener, impressing manager Alex Cora with his versatility.
Monasterio, acquired in a trade with the Brewers, hit .250 with four homers in 68 games for Milwaukee in 2025.
With Romy Gonzalez injured, Monasterio is a candidate for Red Sox's primary platoon infielder role in 2026.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, from Carthage, Maine, was arrested and charged with drug and vehicle operation offenses in Massachusetts.
Beaulieu allegedly crashed his truck twice, first at a Bridgewater rest stop and later in Westport early Thursday morning.
Police found synthetic cannabinoids in Beaulieu's vehicle; he pleaded not guilty and is due in court March 3.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy of Methuen is searching for her wedding dress lost due to a dry cleaner mix-up over 15 years ago.
Dunleavy discovered the error after finding another bride's gown in a preserved box and has used social media to track hers.
The missing dress features buttons, a flower appliqué, and initials 'KS' embroidered inside; information is sought via social media.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed at Chevalier Theatre, combining her gospel-soul roots with modern Americana influences, showcasing her enduring vocal strength.
Staples' set included classics like 'Freedom Highway' and new hits, interspersed with social justice messages and personal anecdotes.
Kimaya Diggs opened the show with smooth R&B tunes, appealing to both new and old fans with her contemporary-retro sound.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox player Wilson Contreras successfully used the ABS challenge system in spring training against a strike three call.
Under the new rules, MLB teams can challenge two balls or strikes per game, with retained challenges if successful.
Players like Roman Anthony and Marcelo Mayer have experience with ABS from Triple-A, unlike some veteran Red Sox players.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned after opting out of his 2025 Red Sox contract to seek a better deal.
Despite a strong 2025 season, Giolito hasn't secured a new contract as spring training begins for 2026.
Boston added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, making Giolito's return unlikely despite past success with the team.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots consider Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr. as a trade target due to his potential availability and skill set.
Bears WR DJ Moore rumored as a trade candidate; trading for him may require contract adjustments due to cap hit.
Jaguars OL Walker Little is an intriguing target for the Patriots to bolster their offensive line at a reasonable cost.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice but has no official return date.
Despite rehabbing from an Achilles tear, Tatum insists he takes recovery one day at a time without rushing.
The Celtics have not provided a timetable for Tatum's return, emphasizing full recovery before playing again.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports' Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko remained silent after Megan Keller's gold-winning goal to capture the moment.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir let Alysa Liu's skate performance shine, staying mostly silent during her routine.
Use of silence by NBC announcers during Team USA wins in women's hockey and figure skating highlighted Olympic broadcasts.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended — for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides on MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using unspent federal funds.
The routes serve Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury, connecting them to key Orange Line stations like Ruggles and Jackson Square.
The pilot program's long-term future is uncertain as city officials discuss potential funding with Gov. Healey's administration.
